title: Designing Language Learning Games Based on Activity Theory

context.additional_context: Self-directed language proficiency improvement in smartphone-accessible microlearning environments. Reinforcing inhibitory control training on language rules through gamified activities without instructor guidance

learning_goals: Learners can make appropriate judgments with 80% accuracy in linguistically contradictory situations within the game
Learners form a habit of applying language rules at least three times per week through gamified tasks
Learners achieve a 20% or greater improvement in language problem-solving speed in assessment tasks

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
